entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character, a boy who is being accused of plotting to steal the house.

entities.name: uncle vernon
entities.description: Harry's uncle, who believes that Harry is plotting to steal the house. He is described as having a vein in his forehead starting to pulse with anger.

entities.name: aunt petunia
entities.description: Harry's aunt, who defends her husband and gets angry when Harry insults him.

entities.name: house
entities.description: The house that Uncle Vernon believes Harry is plotting to steal. It is described as being valuable due to skyrocketing house prices in the area.

relationships.description: Uncle Vernon accuses Harry of plotting to steal the house. This is evident from Uncle Vernon's outburst and his explanation of why he believes Harry wants to steal the house.
Harry and Uncle Vernon have an argument about whether or not Harry is plotting to steal the house. This is evident from their exchange of insults and accusations.
Harry and Aunt Petunia also have an argument, with Aunt Petunia defending her husband and Harry insulting him.
